intro: Filago gallica var. simplex, commonly known as the simple filago, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowering period occurs in the summer months, producing small yellow flowers that attract pollinators. This variety is noted for its simple inflorescence structure, distinguishing it from other varieties of Filago.
